primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The incursion of God's holiness into human reality to transform and re-orient the human subject toward ministry.

tekstueel_bewijs: God had come massively and had changed Moses irreversibly.
God’s holiness touches down in our midst and changes everything.
God will not quit on us.
being transformed into the same image
For this comes from the Lord, the Spirit.
It is the story of your life.
God has not quit... until our life is joyously reflective.
Jesus becomes the pivot where holiness touches humanity.
the church must endlessly tell its Jesus stories.
empty claims where God’s holiness... does not reside
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'seductive' alternative stories and ontological despair that resist God's purpose.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of 'Ministry' as a way of living in the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Human dignity, social justice, healed creation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Ministry is explicitly framed as the 'zinger' or consequence of the primary transformation program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God had come massively and had changed Moses.

voorbeelden: The church must endlessly tell its Jesus stories.
the deepest yearning and the most powerful craving that we have.
He knew that much. What he did not know was...
being transformed... this comes from the Lord.
God will not quit on us.
power that is not resisted, even by our deep despair.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' to change the human subject, rather than the human 'obligation' to change themselves.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Ordinary' (~S2) to the 'Shattered/Dangerous' (S2), then rejects 'Self-help' (~S1) to land in 'Transformation' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'passive' transformation by the Spirit (S1) which enables Ministry.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the holy is described as 'dangerous' and 'threatening' to the status quo.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of transformation and frames human action (ministry) as a gift/mercy rather than a requirement for acceptance.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The church at Corinth is... to practice the memory of Jesus.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: we are being transformed, even in spite of ourselves.
God has not quit, and will not.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Moses and Jesus are used as 'touch-down points' of God's action rather than moral examples to imitate through effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God acts on Moses; God acts in Jesus; God acts on us.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; shifting from the burden of self-transformation to the assurance of God's work.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (God is the primary worker in the believer's growth).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Primary Program' (Transformation) to the 'Secondary Program' (Ministry) is logically and theologically tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'don't try to understand' and the subsequent detailed explanation.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: growing congenial to and reflective of God’s own life.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of 'Pouvoir' (Power) to the incompetent subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as a 'seduction' and 'despair' that only a 'dangerous eruption' of holiness can break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's holiness. The human subject is the beneficiary of action, not the initiator.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters the cultural 'Devoir' (Must) of achievement.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as cultural seduction and internal despair.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the narrative. It avoids the trap of 'self-help' by grounding transformation in the 'dangerous' and 'mercy-filled' activity of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'oddness' metaphor; Greimas shows that this 'oddness' is actually a Subject-shift from Man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'metamorphosis'; Greimas shows how that word functions as a modal change in the hearer's competence.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Ministry' is not a new burden (Devoir) but a result of the Subject (God) successfully achieving the Object (Transformation) in the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the passive voice ('being transformed') strategically to preserve theocentric agency.
